definition: to settle for second best/the next best thing
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: Do not fear item demarcates too high, you possibly need to draw backask next.
sentences.chinese: 不要怕目標定得太高，你可能需要退而求其次。

sentences.english: But modifying patients' immune cells might be the next best thing.
sentences.chinese: 但或許能退而求其次，改造患者的免疫細胞。

sentences.english: He never settles for second best.
sentences.chinese: 他從不滿足於退而求其次。

sentences.english: Borrowing tapes from the library would be the next-best thing.
sentences.chinese: 借磁帶是退而求其次的辦法。

sentences.english: When that was flatly rejected by Dangdang, Amazon had to make the less favorable approach of purchasing Joyo.
sentences.chinese: 結果被噹噹斷然拒絕後只有退而求其次，收購卓越。

definition: to act against one's will/to have no alternative but to/to have to/to have no choice/must
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to drop (subject etc)
without any better option/to have to/to be forced to
to compromise/to take the middle road/a trade-off/eclectic
to have no alternative (idiom); compelled by circumstances/forced into sth
(of sb who ostensibly collaborated with the Japanese during the Sino-Japanese war of 1937-1945) to secretly work for the Nationalists or against the Communists
to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
plan of convenience (idiom); stop-gap measure/makeshift stratagem/interim step
to have no alternative but to/to be obliged to
to suffer/fig. reluctantly
to brace oneself to do sth/to put a bold face on it/to summon up courage/to force oneself to
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
to have no other choice
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
